alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pasquotank, southeastern Camden, southeastern Perquimans and southeastern Currituck Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Newfoundland, or 10 miles south of Weeksville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sanderling, Point Harbor, Jarvisburg, Frog Island, Powells Point, Spot, Listers Corner, Glen Cove, Harbinger and Mamie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
